summary.title: Hello !
summary.content:
I'm Jef Schoolmeester, a passionate and motivated full-stack developer. With over three years of experience, I bring a creative and problem-solving mindset to every project. I thrive on learning new concepts and technologies.
Feel free to explore my portfolio!

experiences.title: Newrest
experiences.content:
Contributed to the development of multiple web applications, working tightly with design and marketing teams.

Smartbar:

  • Developed and maintained a food ordering web application used by the French national trains using Next.js, Redux, Mule soft, Magento2, Docker, and AWS S3.
  • Improved the web application's accessibility by implementing RGAA standards.
  • Implemented Azure AD authentication for the middle office.
  • Created parent docker images reducing build time by 50%.

Smartbar onboard Kiosk:

  • Implemented a kiosk version of Smartbar that runs on trains.
  • Developed a proxy using Node.js, Typescript, and Redis to handle offline mode.
  • Created an Azure DevOps pipeline to build and zip the project.

Connect-eat:

  • Maintained an E-wallet & informative PWA using Next.js, Strapi, and Typescript.
  • Implemented new features such as account management, push notifications, satisfaction, and attendance monitoring.
  • Wrote documentation for a MongoDB to PostgreSQL data migration, facilitating the migration process.

experiences.title: Docdoku
experiences.content:
• Developed and maintained Popafood, a mobile app for online food ordering using React Native and Typescript.
  • Applied test-driven development using jest, react testing library, and detox to ensure quality code and prevent regressions.
  • Participated in weekly scrum meetings.

experiences.title: Atelier de l'Insolite
experiences.content:
• Developed an editable portfolio using Next.js, Strapi, and Sass.
  • Deployed the portfolio on an OVH VPS using Docker and Docker Compose.
  • Implemented admin subdomain for CMS access using Nginx.
  • Implemented https using certbot.

experiences.title: Toxiplan
experiences.content:
• Developed a web platform to manage toxicology reports, utilizing React, Node.js, Express.js, and MongoDB.
  • Led a team of 5 developers, providing mentorship and assistance.
  • Designed the platform's architecture, making key decisions on the technologies and tools used for the project's development.
  • Worked closely with the client to ensure that the platform met the company's needs, delivering weekly updates.
  • Conducted code reviews to ensure quality and minimize the risk of regressions.

experiences.title: Findee
experiences.content:
• Developed and maintained a web app that uses artificial intelligence to recommend clients for b2b businesses, using React, Node.js, Express, and MongoDB.
  • Integrated the app with Zappier to simplify the user's workflow.

projects.title: FOODIFY
content: "Foodify" is a cookbook app designed to provide users with an intuitive and user-friendly experience. Although still a work in progress, one exciting feature in development is a Tinder-like functionality that assists users in finding the perfect recipe to cook.

Through the development of Foodify, I will have to master concepts I'm not familiar with such as CI/CD or cache management. Since it isn't a small project, I will have to choose an architecture considering scalability, maintainability, and code organization.

projects.title: 3D PORTFOLIO
content: This project is an interactive 3D representation of a newspaper kiosk. Inspired by the significance of physical kiosks as sources of information in the pre-internet era, this project aims to bring a unique and engaging experience.
I had the opportunity to learn many technologies. I delved into Three.js, learning new concepts like shaders, postprocessing, and 3D user experience. Additionally, I learned 3D modeling with Blender.

projects.title: REACT PATTERNS
content: "React Patterns" is a project where I explore various design and performance patterns and implement them using React. It serves as a practical guide to understanding and applying different patterns in real-world scenarios.
This project helped me to learn various design patterns. Finding the right example for each pattern also showed me when I should or shouldn't use these patterns.

projects.title: REACT SCROLL
content: I wanted to experiment with react and interactive animations, so I came up with this simple project. The application consists of one page where a large round text in the background rotates as the user scrolls.

While this project may not have presented significant technical challenges, it provided an opportunity for continuous improvement and practice. Working with React, and Sass allowed me to further strengthen my skills in building interactive user interfaces.

projects.title: CRYPTO WALLET
content: The Crypto Wallet app allows you to manage your cryptocurrency portfolio, keep track of its performance, and access your transaction history. Additionally, you can monitor the top 100 popular cryptocurrencies and perform buying or selling transactions.

I had the opportunity to expand my skill set. Firstly, I learned to use chart libraries and visually showcase data. Then, I connected the app to an external API to fetch real-time market data and learned how to cache these results.
